utterances.text: Here are some of the dishes for you. The first one is Fast and Easy Pasta With Blistered Cherry Tomato Sauce.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Oh! Wow. That sounds really good. They even have canned cherry tomatoes here.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Pasta doesn't get much quicker or easier than this—the sauce requires four ingredients and is ready in the same amount of time it takes to cook the noodles. Its bright flavors come from garlic, basil, and cherry tomatoes, which we saute until they burst. Because cherry tomatoes have lots of pectin, their juice easily emulsifies with olive oil and pasta water to form a light sauce.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Wow.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Well, that sounds really good. Good job.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Second one is Pasta With Butternut Squash and Sage Brown Butter.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: While it's still chilly outside, make this warming pasta, dressed up with browned butter, fresh sage, and tender chunks of butternut squash. We like to use small cupped pasta shapes, like orecchiette, to capture the rich, nutty sauce. Lemon juice is the secret ingredient that prevents the browned butter from burning. If you struggle with cutting the tough, irregularly shaped squash, we've got a handy video guide to help you out.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: And the third one is Ricotta Gnocchi With Asparagus and Prosciutto.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Celebrate the coming of warmer days by pairing fresh asparagus with heavy cream, Parmigiano-Reggiano, crispy prosciutto, and bright lemon. This dish takes only 20 minutes if you have store-bought gnocchi on hand, but making these simple ricotta gnocchi from scratch adds just another half hour to the process.

utterances.text: This has been and will remain my favorite place to eat in New Orleans. The menu is mouth-watering and original, but packed with that Creole/Cajun flavor you can't get enough of. Upstairs is truly the spot to be, with beautiful walls of windows overlooking century-old trees and the garden district. Topping it off, the live band at Sunday brunch makes it a restaurant to not only eat but to build memories. The chef is of incredible talent. For anyone looking for an authentic New Orleans soul food brunch, the palace is a must!

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Owned and operated by the Zoccoli family since 1948 . In March of 1948, Robert Zoccoli Sr. and his wife, Augusta, both Italian immigrants, along with their daughter Nelli and her husband Lloyd Sherman, formed a partnership and bought a small grocery store. The Plaza Grocery, a Red & White Food Store, was located in downtown Santa Cruz where Zoccoli's Deli resides now. It was a very diversified operation that sold everything from household supplies to deli meats and cheeses, many of which we still carry today.

utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.text: Bye.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: The first is called August, it has 4.4 stars.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: New French fare at chef John Besh's flagship restaurant in a chandelier-studded 19th-century space.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: The second is called Antoine's Restaurant, it has 4 stars.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Circa-1840 old-world grand dame of fine French-Creole dining & birthplace of oysters Rockefeller.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Which one do you want?

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: August.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Alright. Goodbye.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Think of aloo tikki as delicious Indian potato fritters. These appetizers or snacks are made with mashed potatoes and a variety of spices, formed into patties, then fried in oil. You'll find them sold on the streets of Northern India and on the menu of your local takeout.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Mango Chutney: This quintessential Indian condiment is used to top many Indian appetizers and is made with mangoes, vinegar, sugar, and spices. Mango chutney is probably the most recognizable chutney, and the most widely available, but chutneys can be made from a number of other ingredients including mint and tamarind.

utterances.text: Think of samosas as being an Indian version of empanadas. These are a favorite appetizer made with with a flaky pastry enveloping a hearty filling of potatoes and vegetables. They're folded into triangles, fried, and served with chutneys.

utterances.speaker: USER
utterances.text: Okay, why don't you go ahead and send that to me all in my email?

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Raita is your best friend if you're having Indian food for the first time. Not exactly sure how spicy your dish is going to be? Think you might not be able to handle it? Have no fear. Raita's got your back. This cooling cucumber-mint yogurt sauce will dial down the heat if things get too hot.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: Momos are simply Indian dumplings. The spices used in the filling and sauce are more characteristic of Indian cuisine than Chinese cuisine, but like dumplings, momos are steamed or fried and come with a variety of vegetable and meat fillings.

utterances.speaker: ASSISTANT
utterances.text: You're welcome.

utterances.text: See you later bye.
